comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Admiral Wei Han was director of war ship construction for the Chinese government. He was the head of a commission which came in the U.S. in 1915 for six month mainly to study American methods in constructing submarines, see article "CHINA'S 'WASPS' LIKE U. S. BOATS - Admiral Wei Han in Honolulu En Route Home After Six Months on Mainland" in the Honolulu star-bulletin, March 23, 1916, 3:30 Edition, Page 2, 4th column. See also theadmiralandthewren.com.au/behind-the-name/
